intro: Alsine macrocarpa lusus laxa, commonly known as the broadleaf sandparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, compound leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
